alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 10:57AM PST until January 01 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in California...Nevada... Truckee River Near Truckee affecting Placer and Nevada Counties. West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. East Fork Carson River Below Markleeville affecting Alpine and Douglas Counties. Carson River Near Carson City affecting Carson City, Churchill, Douglas and Lyon independent cities. For the Truckee River...including Truckee, Farad, Reno, Vista, Wadsworth...elevated river levels are forecast. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...elevated river levels are forecast. For the East Fork Carson River...including Markleeville, Gardnerville...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Mainstem Carson River...including Carson City...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...East Fork Carson River Below Markleeville. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Monitor Stage. No flooding from from Monitor Creek to Bryant Creek, river near bankfull and may require precautionary measures to move resources away from the river. Additional impacts to recreational river users. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PST Friday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.1 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by tomorrow morning.
